titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3442, DEBT MANAGEMENT AND FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY ACT OF 2015, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R.

name.namePart: Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3442, DEBT MANAGEMENT AND FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY ACT OF 2015, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R.; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 24

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Scientific Research in the National Interest Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3293, to provide for greater accountability in Federal funding for scientific research, to promote the progress of science in the �D126�United States that serves that national interest, by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 178 noes, Roll No. 70.<P/>Rejected the Edwards motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with amendments, by a recorded vote of 177 ayes to 241 noes, Roll No. 69.<P/>Eddie Bernice Johnson (TX) amendment (No. 2 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-420) that sought to replace subsection 2(b), ``Determination'', to ensure that such determination is consistent with the mission of the agency and with the existing merit-review criteria (by a recorded vote of 181 ayes to 235 noes, Roll No. 68).<P/>H. Res. 609, the rule providing for consideration of the bills (H.R. 3442) and (H.R. 3293) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 178 noes, Roll No. 66, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 237 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 65.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Scientific Research in the National Interest Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3293, to provide for greater accountability in Federal funding for scientific research, to promote the progress of science in the �D126�United States that serves that national interest, by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 178 noes, Roll No. 70.<P/>Rejected the Edwards motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with amendments, by a recorded vote of 177 ayes to 241 noes, Roll No. 69.<P/>Eddie Bernice Johnson (TX) amendment (No. 2 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-420) that sought to replace subsection 2(b), ``Determination'', to ensure that such determination is consistent with the mission of the agency and with the existing merit-review criteria (by a recorded vote of 181 ayes to 235 noes, Roll No. 68).<P/>H. Res. 609, the rule providing for consideration of the bills (H.R. 3442) and (H.R. 3293) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 178 noes, Roll No. 66, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 237 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 65.

congCommittee.name: Committee on Science, Space, and Technology
Science, Space, and Technology

titleInfo.title: SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT IMPROVED COMPLIANCE AWARENESS ACT

extension.searchTitle: SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT IMPROVED COMPLIANCE AWARENESS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 24

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Safe Drinking Water Act Improved Compliance Awareness Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measure:<P/>H.R. 4470, amended, to amend the Safe Drinking Water Act with respect to the requirements related to lead in drinking water, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 416 yeas to 2 nays, Roll No. 67.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Scientific Research in the National Interest Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3293, to provide for greater accountability in Federal funding for scientific research, to promote the progress of science in the �D126�United States that serves that national interest, by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 178 noes, Roll No. 70.<P/>Rejected the Edwards motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with amendments, by a recorded vote of 177 ayes to 241 noes, Roll No. 69.<P/>Eddie Bernice Johnson (TX) amendment (No. 2 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-420) that sought to replace subsection 2(b), ``Determination'', to ensure that such determination is consistent with the mission of the agency and with the existing merit-review criteria (by a recorded vote of 181 ayes to 235 noes, Roll No. 68).

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.

extension.searchTitle: NORTH KOREA SANCTIONS ENFORCEMENT ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 24

congVote.result: The bill (H.R. 757), as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By a unanimous vote of 96 yeas (Vote No. 20), Senate passed H.R. 757, to improve the enforcement of sanctions against the Government of North Korea, after agreeing to the committee amendment in the nature of a substitute.
